Interaction: Any user on the internal network <--> PostgreSQL Database
Exploitation Description: Attacker could login with PostgreSQL default user credentials
Attack Surface: The open ports on the DB
Impact: Loss, modification, or theft of data
Mitigation: Remove default user or change the default credentials

Interaction: Any authenticated user <--> Rails API Service
Exploitation Description: User sends a malicious payload of commands which get executed on Rails API
Attack Surface: User connections to the Rails API
Impact: Remote code execution leads to control of the system

Interaction: Any authenticated user <--> Rails API Service
Exploitation Description: Web Server could be subject to cross site scripting
Attack Surface: User connections to the Web Server

Exploitation Description: An attacker could send a fake Authenticator response token to the application and take actions as an authorized user
Attack Surface: Connection between Rails API and Authenticator
Impact: Loss, modification, or theft of data

Interaction: Any authenticated user <--> Rails API Service <--> Database
Attack Surface: Any user input that gets processed into a Database query
Impact: Loss, modification, or theft of data

Interaction: Any user on the internal network <--> Database
Exploitation Description: PostgreSQL server accepts connections from anyone on the internal network
Impact: Loss, modification, or theft of data
Mitigation: Whitelist the application servers so only they can open a connection

Exploitation Description: Spoofing the DB to trick the Rails API into reading from or writing to a malicious database
Attack Surface: The connection between the Database and Rails Server
Mitigation: Validate the DB server and use a secure channel

Interaction: proxy <--> Any user on the internal network <--> Rails API
Exploitation Description: User sits on the connection between the proxy and an application server to sniff un-encrypted traffic
Attack Surface: Connection between the application servers and the proxy
Impact: Theft credentials or modification of data
Mitigation: Encrypt communication between the proxy and the application servers

Interaction: Any user on the internal network <-(Direct)-> Docker Container Port
Exploitation Description: Docker containers allow connections on ports other than the ones opened for application services
Impact: Opens up the attack surface for other exploits

Interaction: Any user on the internal network <--> Rails API Service
Exploitation Description: Denial of service via resource consumption. The application does not limit traffic flow
Attack Surface: User connections to the Rails API or Web Server
Impact: The application's service would become unavailable

Interaction: Any user on the internal network <-(Direct)-> Rails API Service
Exploitation Description: User bypasses the load balancer and proxy to directly connect to the application Server
Impact: Bypass the load balancer for easier DoS and loss of HTTPS
Mitigation: Whitelist the proxy so only it can connect to application servers
